issues.description: The problem statement specifies a no-argument method checkOrderReady(): void and instructs orderMeal() to call checkOrderReady(). The solution implementation defines checkOrderReady(boolean enableLogging) (a boolean parameter) and has orderMeal() call checkOrderReady(true). This is a method-parameter mismatch: the solution's method signature does not match the specification/UML and will confuse students about the required API and tests expecting the no-arg method.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem specification by changing checkOrderReady to the no-argument signature checkOrderReady(): void and updating its internal logic to perform any logging conditionally (e.g., via a private flag or a separate debug method) or remove debug logging. Also update orderMeal() to call checkOrderReady() with no parameters. Alternatively, if the boolean parameter is intentional, update the problem statement/UML to document checkOrderReady(boolean) so students know the correct signature.

issues.description: The problem statement declares a no-argument method checkOrderReady(): void (UML and textual description), but the solution implementation defines checkOrderReady(boolean enableLogging). The name matches but the signature differs (extra boolean parameter). This divergence creates a mapping confusion: students reading the problem expect a no-arg method to implement and tests or instructional text referring to checkOrderReady() will not directly match the solution's method signature. It also forces either changing calls (e.g., orderMeal currently calls checkOrderReady(true) in the solution) or adding an overload, which is an unnecessary implementation-detail mismatch between problem and solution.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the solution with the problem by providing a no-argument checkOrderReady() method. Either (a) change the current method signature to public void checkOrderReady() and handle internal logging via a private field or internal helper, or (b) add a public no-arg overload public void checkOrderReady() that delegates to the existing checkOrderReady(boolean) (e.g., checkOrderReady(true)). Also update internal calls (orderMeal) to invoke the no-arg method to match the problem statement.
